title: A Map of Valoran and (Most) of Runeterra
body:
So I decided I am going to draw a map for Runeterra, because the current one in the old lore is outrageously outdated (its a f****** circle) and desperately needs updating. So I'm going to try my best and hand draw (Yes I'm seriously doing it by hand) and its going to take a while. I'll post it here to show how you guys how far along I'm going. 
Everything is a WIP until I say so.

http://pre07.deviantart.net/9095/th/pre/f/2016/229/e/2/runeterra_base_by_strikerprime27-dae7xw4.png
[](http://pre07.deviantart.net/9095/th/pre/f/2016/229/e/2/runeterra_base_by_strikerprime27-dae7xw4.png)

This is the base for the Map so far... I want to make this as detailed as possible and its going to be a challenge. I have have split the map into 4 quadrants So I can detail it much better. Also...Thinking of Making the Blue Flame Islands a bit bigger and shifting it more to the right...

Mountain Concepts: IronSpike, Tempest Flats, The Great Barrier, and Mt. Targon

http://pre02.deviantart.net/a899/th/pre/i/2016/229/b/8/mountain_lmc_by_strikerprime27-dae80pv.jpg

Very Early Concept of the first Quadrant: Freljord, Piltover, Zaun, and the Ironspike Mts.

Here's the Location for All Major Landmarks. I've put in a lot of thought on where everything is and also using logic:
http://img11.deviantart.net/86fe/i/2016/229/7/f/landmark_locations_by_strikerprime27-dae89or.jpg
[](http://img11.deviantart.net/86fe/i/2016/229/7/f/landmark_locations_by_strikerprime27-dae89or.jpg)

[Tu ~7:00 ish AM]I am using this specific sheet as my final sheet, obviously still a WIP. Each square you see is 2inX2in. Drawing Freljord hurts like hell especially since I splitted in quadrants. Who can spot Rakelstake from the map?
http://img01.deviantart.net/ceed/i/2016/229/5/a/pzf_map_by_strikerprime27-dae89jh.jpg
[](http://img01.deviantart.net/ceed/i/2016/229/5/a/pzf_map_by_strikerprime27-dae89jh.jpg)
[Tu 9:45 AM]Seriously I'm hoping that the current illustration of Freljord is still canon, at least I have that part of the map to work with...

[Tu 11:52 PM] Ok guys, heres my game plan from everyone's feedback. I will add a 4x24 in area down straight through Valoran, giving me room to expand the Runeterra, and especially the S. Valoran on the way. This will also give me some clarity, of the divide spreading the Supercontinent in half. Expanding this will also allow me to shift Ionia a few inches south.

[We 2:57 AM] Update made Ionia 35% bigger, and central Valoran larger :) here's the current map. Low quality as I don't want to use the scanner atm.
http://img11.deviantart.net/e12a/i/2016/229/8/a/expanded_runeterra_map_by_strikerprime27-daec9bd.jpg

Here's relative size, and that's a large notebook.

[](http://img09.deviantart.net/2974/i/2016/229/9/5/map_size_by_strikerprime27-daecajm.jpg)

[We 4:30 AM] I'm using this texture for the The Great Barrier which consists of Mount Targon, Tempest Flats, and Morgon Pass! Probably not that color for Mt. Targon though...
http://pre08.deviantart.net/cdbf/th/pre/i/2016/230/4/5/gb_color_scheme_by_strikerprime27-daeck8h.jpg
[](http://pre08.deviantart.net/cdbf/th/pre/i/2016/230/4/5/gb_color_scheme_by_strikerprime27-daeck8h.jpg)

I'm taking a bit of a break for a bit..
 
[Th 4:45 AM] A friend recommended I use a program to render the artwork, I'm playing around with it with some scans. Its going great!

[Th 7:52 AM] Progress being made, I have most of Runeterra drawn, Ionia has its landmarks, the city of Shurima has been drawn! Need to add more stuff though... like the damn jungles, Bilgewater, and the Shadow Isles. I felt like I could have done more for Noxus though... Well most if them live in the Immortal Bastion anyway... More to come!!!

http://img12.deviantart.net/2741/i/2016/231/4/3/runeterra_outline__1_by_strikerprime27-daehfg0.jpg

###### Alright so I'm dancing with danger here.  I probably shouldn't be here, in this thread.  Plx don't kill me.

Not bad!  Certainly closer than the old, no-longer-canon, map.  There are a few things I'd change, a few seas I'd add (Gangplank boasts of his conquests) and nations I'd swivel or swap around, but still - not bad.  Good work especially on the Freljord outline from the event map, though depending on your projection, it might be a little undersized.

I couldn't spot Rakelstake (I was looking for a frozen lake, but I guess at this scale it's not even going to be a pixel), but saw the Howling Abyss bridge.

Because I've had this issue myself, and worked out what I believe is a tolerable solution, have you encountered 'The Serpentine Problem' yet?  Any thoughts on how you're going to resolve it?  From the looks of your map, this isn't the first one you've ever drawn, but quite a few people can get tripped up by rivers.  (And that's not even including Azir's shenanigans!)

(I'm really hoping we get to release a map to players some time before the heat-death of the universe, but I don't know what the dates would be on that.  I know it's unacceptable - I try to convey that in meetings and such, but **quite understandably** it doesn't stack very high on the priority list against updated bios, new champs, the new client, and other more far reaching things.  Progress is being made, I swear.)

Ionia = Solo continent (think Australia)

From what I understand, the Jungles - namely Kumungu and The Plague Jungles are located in the South Continent (S. Valoran) Because that's where {{champion:76}}  came from or at least raised,  while Satan{{champion:17}} gets his Mushrooms.

Yeah I am having problems locating rivers... at one point I do know that the serpentine river ran through Summoner's Rift, but got reconned from the lore, now it's at Bilgewater? And rivers in the Shurima Desert are all connected from Shurima itself from the Oasis of the Dawn. I'm going to have to find where all those rivers exit though. I'll probably have the ones going south make a lake near where the Kumungu and Plague jungles are in the south...

As for the Seas... I might have to add extentions to the map. Especially in the west, probably 2x8 in extentsion, for the east a 4x8 in speaking each square is 2 inches... I'm working with sketch paper notebook here lol.
Is there physically a void rift which void creatures get through or these void rifts are randomly generated over shurima desert?

The major rift would be in the ruins of Icathia, which is located somewhere close to the Sai region of the Shurima Desert. Personally, I believe that it would also be relatively close to Urtistan as well, but that would be assuming that Vel'Koz came through to Runeterra from Icathia's rift as well.
I need to look at the relative locations of how far these regions are apart, the old map depicts Urtistan and Icathia in the opposite regions of S. Valoran.

Yeah, I was piecing it together, and I came up with a Theory. Icathia is in the Sai region of the Shuriman Desert. Which could mean, presumably, that Rek'Sai came through from Icathia or very close by. We know that Malzahar and Kassadin both wandered through the Deserts of Shurima until they found Icathia. Kog'Maw spawned from Icathia as well. If we assume this trend, then the largest point of spawning is coming from Icathia in the south eastern region of The Sai, which is where Rek'Sai has marked her territory. And it appears that there are very few other places where the Void-born are spotting. They appear near Mt. Targon, but Mt. Targon was one of the peaks of the Great Barrier, which is directly north of the Shurima Desert anyway. With no other things to go on, I have hypothesized that Vel'Koz manifested in or near Icathia and was able to make it to Urtistan reasonably soon afterwards, which possibly means a few things:

1) Icathia and Urtistan are not as far apart as the original map would have us believe
2) The travel time for Void Creatures would somehow move differently (Rek'Sai can move underground at speeds outrunning horses by quite a clip)
3) There's another rift in an as-of-yet undisclosed location very close to Urtistan, which means the original Rift in Icathia is getting significantly larger
Great point! I haven't drawn those two yet, I'll be working on drawing the jungles south

As someone who also made a map of Runeterra a while back, please allow me to give you a suggestion or two!  =)

Firstly, though we're not sure of sizes, Jaredan has confirmed there are at _least_ (meaning there are likely more) three continents on Runeterra.  The ones we know about are Valoran, Ionia, and the "Southern Continent."  Valoran contains most of what we're familiar with on the top half of the map from the old "Pancake Map" as I call it.  The "Southern Continent" contains Shurima, and likely things from the southern half of the map we're familiar with.  Ionia is probably larger than it once was, and is its own continent now as well to some degree.

Honestly, the biggest thing I can suggest is that you should do your own thing!

Don't feel constrained by the old pancake map, and let your creative juices guide you.  Take chances, break from the established mold, and do things your own way.  Runeterra is a world, with continents, seas, and all kinds of huge geographical areas and features.  These things are your playground to do with as you please!  There are lots of hints hidden in newer lore, especially the Shurima lores, that give away how the area is put together, and you can use those to help guide you too.

In any case, I wish you the best of luck.  And remember to have fun, even when the damn Serpentine River makes you want to tear your hair out!
